column4: I have an Ubuntu server running ssh-server. Right now I use a random port for it, but at school the port I am using is blocked, so I can't ssh into the server from school. I know that 20,21,possibly 22 are open. I have been told to never use the "default ports" for security reasons, but if my password it strong, I'll be ok won't i?
as long as your password is strong, and your data is not on russias list, youre fine
What about "default" acconts? I log on as matt, so what other things should I perhaps secure?
